title: Bug 37021 - Source path wrong in declare warning on binary files
description:
Bug 37021 - Source path wrong in declare warning on binary files.

Bug 37021 describes an issue where the source path is incorrect in declare warning messages when targeting .class files from injars. Currently, the source path is listed in the form 'app.Main.class' instead of 'app/Main'. The problem can be reproduced by running the code provided in the 'tests/new/binaryWarnings/..' directory.

It is worth noting that these tests have limitations. They may generate false positives due to the lack of filename checking in the harness verification of messages. Additionally, in some cases, the filenames may not appear at all.

Expected Behavior: The source path in declare warning messages should be correctly formatted as 'app/Main' when targeting .class files from injars.
OB: In declare warning messages when targeting .class files from injars, the source path is listed in the form 'app.Main.class' rather than 'app/Main'. Additionally, there are instances where the filenames do not appear at all, although these tests do not reproduce that problem.
EB: The source path in declare warning messages should be listed in the correct format, 'app/Main', when targeting .class files from injars.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the provided code in the 'tests/new/binaryWarnings/..' directory.
2. Trigger the declare warning messages when targeting .class files from injars.
3. Observe that the source path is displayed incorrectly as 'app.Main.class' instead of 'app/Main'.
